briefdescription.para: stores training sequence numbers for channels different than C0
stores cell allocation - absolute rf channel numbers (ARFCNs) assigned to the given cell. The variable should at least contain C0 channel number.

sectiondef.header: Variables used to store result of the find_fcch_burst fuction

briefdescription.para: position of the first sample of the fcch burst
frequency offset set in frequency shifter located upstream

sectiondef.header: Identifiers of the BTS extracted from the SCH burst
Internal state of the gsm receiver
Variables which make internal state in the "synchronized" state

briefdescription.para: encoded training sequence of a SCH burst
encoded training sequences of a normal and dummy burst

detaileddescription.para: Counts samples consumed by the receiver

It is used in beetween find_fcch_burst and reach_sch_burst calls. My intention was to synchronize this counter with some internal sample counter of the USRP. Simple access to such USRP's counter isn't possible so this variable isn't used in the "synchronized" state of the receiver yet.

briefdescription.para: number of subsequent erroneous SCH bursts

detaileddescription.para: Function whis is used to search a FCCH burst and to compute frequency offset before "synchronized" state of the receiver

parameterdescription.para: number of samples in the input vector

detaileddescription.para: Computes frequency offset from FCCH burst samples

parameterdescription.para: number of the first sample of the FCCH busrt
number of the last sample of the FCCH busrt
contains frequency offset estimate if FCCH burst was located

simplesect.para: true if frequency offset was faound

detaileddescription.para: Computes angle between two complex numbers
Function whis is used to get near to SCH burst

parameterdescription.para: number of samples in the gsm_receiver's buffer

simplesect.para: true if SCH burst is near, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Extracts channel impulse response from a SCH burst and computes first sample number of this burst

parameterdescription.para: complex vector where channel impulse response will be stored

simplesect.para: number of first sample of the burst

memberdef.argsstring: (const gr_complex *input, gr_complex *chan_imp_resp, int burst_start, unsigned char *output_binary)
memberdef.name: detect_burst

detaileddescription.para: MLSE detection of a burst bits

Detects bits of burst using viterbi algorithm.
input
vector with input samples
chan_imp_resp
vector with the channel impulse response
burst_start
number of the first sample of the burst
output_binary
vector with output bits
